message.content:
cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.GT, cs.CG, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with the computational complexity of combinatorial games played on graphs, which falls under the scope of theoretical computer science. Specifically, the paper focuses on distance games, which involve graph distances and coloring vertices subject to certain distance constraints. This suggests that the paper could belong to cs.CC (computational complexity), cs.DS (data structures and algorithms), cs.GT (discrete mathematics and combinatorics), cs.CG (computational geometry), or cs.AI (artificial intelligence), as these sub-categories are all relevant to the study of combinatorial games and graph algorithms. Among these, cs.CC and cs.DS are the most likely categories, as the paper deals with the computational complexity of the games and requires the development of algorithms to solve them.
